intro: Hemianemia aspera, commonly known as the rough hemianthus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and spikes of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are covered in fine, rough hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Hemianemia aspera is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
